Users Service API¶

This section documents the Users microservice: authentication, user management, roles, and booking-history delegation to the Bookings service.

users_service.main.change_user_role(user_id: int, role_update: ~users_service.schemas.UserRoleUpdate, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), _: ~users_service.models.User = Depends(dependency=<function require_roles.<locals>.dependency>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Admin only: Update a user’s role.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – User to modify.

  • role_update (UserRoleUpdate) – New role to assign.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Updated user with new role.

Return type:

UserRead

Raises:

HTTPException – If user does not exist.

users_service.main.delete_my_account(db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), current_user: ~users_service.models.User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Delete the authenticated user’s own account.

Restrictions¶

  • AUDITOR and SERVICE_ACCOUNT roles cannot delete accounts.

param db:

Database session.

type db:

Session

param current_user:

The user executing the delete operation.

type current_user:

User

rtype:

None

raises HTTPException:

If user role is read-only.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session.

None

Raises:

HTTPException – If user is not found.

users_service.main.get_my_profile(current_user: ~users_service.models.User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Retrieve the authenticated user’s own profile.

Parameters:

current_user (User) – Extracted from JWT token.

Returns:

The profile of the authenticated user.

Return type:

UserRead

users_service.main.get_user_booking_history(user_id: int, current_user: ~users_service.models.User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Retrieve a user’s full booking history via the Bookings service.

Access Rules¶

  • Admin & Auditor: may view any user’s history.

  • Regular user: may view only their own history.

Implementation Notes¶

  • Generates a service-account JWT.

  • Calls Bookings service: GET /bookings?user_id=<id>

param user_id:

User whose history is requested.

type user_id:

int

param current_user:

Requesting user.

type current_user:

User

returns:

{ “user_id”: int, “bookings”: list }

rtype:

dict

raises HTTPException:

If unauthorized or Bookings service errors.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Matching user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If user does not exist.

Admin/Auditor: Retrieve all users.

db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

All registered users.

Return type:

List[UserRead]

Raises:

HTTPException – If caller does not have ADMIN or AUDITOR role.

users_service.main.login(form_data: ~fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(dependency=None, use_cache=True, scope=None), db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Authenticate a user and return a JWT access token.

Parameters:

  • form_data (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – Login credentials (username + password).

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Access token with role and user_id embedded.

Return type:

Token

Raises:

HTTPException – If authentication fails.

users_service.main.make_service_account_token() → str[source]¶
users_service.main.register_user(user_in: ~users_service.schemas.UserCreate, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Register a new user.

Behavior: - First account created becomes ADMIN. - All subsequent public registrations become REGULAR users. - Username and email must be unique. - Password strength is validated before hashing.

Parameters:

  • user_in (UserCreate) – Incoming registration data.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

The newly created user.

Return type:

UserRead

Raises:

HTTPException – If username/email already exist or password is weak.

users_service.main.reset_user_password(user_id: int, body: ~users_service.schemas.PasswordReset, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), _: ~users_service.models.User = Depends(dependency=<function require_roles.<locals>.dependency>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Admin: Reset another user’s password.

Validates password strength before hashing.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user whose password is being reset.

  • body (PasswordReset) – Contains the new password.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Return type:

None

Raises:

HTTPException – If user does not exist or password is weak.

users_service.main.root()[source]¶
users_service.main.update_my_profile(update_data: ~users_service.schemas.UserUpdate, db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None), current_user: ~users_service.models.User = Depends(dependency=<function get_current_user>, use_cache=True, scope=None))[source]¶

Update the authenticated user’s profile.

Editable fields: - name - email (must be unique)

Restrictions: - AUDITOR and SERVICE_ACCOUNT roles cannot update profiles.

Parameters:

  • update_data (UserUpdate) – Fields to update.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • current_user (User) – The authenticated user.

Returns:

Updated user profile.

Return type:

UserRead

Raises:

HTTPException – If email already exists or role is read-only.

users_service.main.validate_password_strength(password: str)[source]¶

Validate password complexity rules.

A valid password must: - Be at least 8 characters long - Contain at least one letter - Contain at least one digit

Parameters:

password (str) – The raw password submitted by the user.

Raises:

HTTPException – If the password does not meet the strength requirements.

Models¶

class users_service.models.User(**kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Base

SQLAlchemy model for application users.

This model stores authentication and authorization information such as username, hashed password, and role.

id¶

Primary key.

Type:

int

name¶

Full display name of the user.

Type:

str

username¶

Unique username used for login.

Type:

str

email¶

Unique email address of the user.

Type:

str

hashed_password¶

Bcrypt-hashed password.

Type:

str

role¶

Role controlling access privileges.

Type:

UserRole

is_active¶

Flag indicating whether the user is active.

Type:

bool

created_at¶

Timestamp of user creation.

Type:

datetime

class users_service.models.UserRole(*values)[source]¶

Bases: str, Enum

Enumeration of all supported user roles in the system.

Roles¶

admin

Full administrative privileges across all services.

regular

Standard end user with access to their own data and bookings.

facility_manager

Power user for rooms and bookings (inventory/space management).

moderator

Lightweight review administrator with moderation rights.

auditor

Read-only user for compliance and auditing.

service_account

Non-human account used for inter-service communication.

ADMIN = 'admin'¶
AUDITOR = 'auditor'¶
FACILITY_MANAGER = 'facility_manager'¶
MODERATOR = 'moderator'¶
REGULAR = 'regular'¶
SERVICE_ACCOUNT = 'service_account'¶

Database¶

users_service.database.get_db()[source]¶

Yield a SQLAlchemy database session.

This is used as a FastAPI dependency to provide a scoped session per request and ensure it is properly closed.

Yields:

Session – Active SQLAlchemy session bound to the configured engine.

Authentication & RBAC¶

users_service.auth.authenticate_user(db: Session, username: str, password: str) → User | None[source]¶

Authenticate a user given username and password.

Parameters:

  • db (Session) – Database session.

  • username (str) – Username provided by the client.

  • password (str) – Plaintext password provided by the client.

Returns:

The authenticated user if credentials are valid, otherwise None.

Return type:

Optional[User]

users_service.auth.create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: timedelta | None = None) → str[source]¶

Create a signed JWT access token.

Parameters:

  • data (dict) – Claims to embed in the token (e.g. ‘sub’, ‘role’, ‘user_id’).

  • expires_delta (Optional[timedelta]) – Optional custom expiration interval.

Returns:

Encoded JWT string.

Return type:

str

async users_service.auth.get_current_user(token: str = Depends(dependency=<fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>, use_cache=True, scope=None), db: ~sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session = Depends(dependency=<function get_db>, use_cache=True, scope=None)) → User[source]¶

Resolve the current user from a JWT bearer token.

Steps¶

  • Decode the JWT using the shared SECRET_KEY.

  • Extract the username and optional role.

  • Load the user from the database.

  • Optionally verify that the token role matches the database role.

param token:

Bearer token from the Authorization header.

type token:

str

param db:

Database session.

type db:

Session

returns:

The authenticated user.

rtype:

User

raises HTTPException:

If the token is invalid, expired, or the user does not exist.

users_service.auth.get_password_hash(password: str) → str[source]¶

Hash a plaintext password using bcrypt.

Parameters:

password (str) – The raw password to hash.

Returns:

Bcrypt hash suitable for storage.

Return type:

str

users_service.auth.require_roles(allowed_roles: List[UserRole])[source]¶

Build a dependency that enforces role-based access control.

Parameters:

allowed_roles (List[UserRole]) – Roles that are allowed to access the protected endpoint.

Returns:

A FastAPI dependency that verifies the current user’s role and raises HTTP 403 if not permitted.

Return type:

Callable

users_service.auth.verify_password(plain_password: str, hashed_password: str) → bool[source]¶

Verify a plaintext password against a bcrypt hash.

Parameters:

  • plain_password (str) – Raw password provided by the user.

  • hashed_password (str) – Previously stored bcrypt hash.

Returns:

True if the password matches, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
